author: Denison Luz
title: University Cardano Research Program
description: Creating new Cardano education and learning centres and labs is a big challenge which involves many aspects like location and equipments

assessments.note:
Generic problem and solution statements with no backup of feasability, resources or experience.

"Creating new Cardano education and learning centres and labs" -> "speed up the learning and adoption of Cardano by using existing universities labs, equipments and networks."

The problem statement and the basic idea of this proposals are addressing the challenge of creating local community centers for further dissemination of Cardona by educating students. However, the solution proposed: "…speed up the learning and adoption of Cardano by using existing universities labs, equipments and networks" is not worked out at all.  The proposal has not changed since its first draft, no real action how to achieve or support this goal is described. Two stars are for the relevance of the idea, but for the substance of the project one star would have been more appropriate.

For me this proposal does address the challenge and proposes a version of the LCC that could be applied in the form of what the proposer suggests be called: UNIVERSITY CARDANO RESEARCH PROGRAM (UCRP). One problem that I see with it - preventing it from effectively addresses the challenge in current form - is that it seems like a general recipe, without a specific implementation plan in a specific community by by using specific existing university labs, equipment and networks.

The proposal should include a plan for action in a certain real environment, real physical location or candidate sites that could be approached for implementation. As its stands now, it is more of an idea - than an implementation proposal in my view.

The idea presented addresses the challenge, since the idea would be that universities were the community centers that would allow leveraging the infrastructure and technology-prone students, but there is no solid plan on how to turn the idea into a real program. For the idea to be implemented, a partnership with local universities would have to be created and there is no mention of any university that can be used as a model, I recommend that the proposer address this aspect of the proposal.
no experience related to labs, universities or otherise mentoned in the offer.

There is no plan at all, also no team or reference to an existing university are given. As the project claims to leverage existing universities resources for the dissemination of Cardona applications, in no way any positive rating for the probability of success for this proposal is possible.

The proposal and its plan is very good as a concept, but less so as a plan for implementation. The budget is a lump sum and there are no specific  milestones, deliverables, KPIs, budget breakdown. As such it is difficult to determine whether it can be implemented successfully. There could be more information provided about the proposer's experience.

The plan describes a general and reasonable view of the idea, justifies the reasons for transforming universities into community centers, but doesn't describe how it will approach universities. I recommend that the proposer provide more details about their professional experiences and qualifications and add links to Linkedin and Github .

Same arguments as above. The proposal has not changed (besides one single sentence) since its first draft, no real action how to achieve or support this goal is described. Besides, there is no information what the budget of USD 15'000 should be used for. I looks like the attempt to claim low hanging fruits.

This proposal is too general and does not provide sufficient information for me to assess its feasibility. It is a proposed concept for an LCC and a relatively interesting one, but implementation is related to feasibility and I do not see enough information addressing how will it be implemented. It does address the challenge in terms of focus, but it is too general in its approach.

There is no roadmap, milestones, KPIs, details about budget allocation and details about the proposer's professional experiences and qualifications. The proposal addresses the challenge, but it is necessary to clarify how the approach of universities will be.

solution: We can speed up the learning and adoption of Cardano by using existing universities labs, equipments and networks.
experience: Senior User Interface Developer with over 10 years of experience in web development and team management.
